content: Really good points. I’ve recently started implementing a similar workflow. The issue I’m running into is that I’m solely a designer and often times hand off my designs to one of our developers to work their magic. Currently that hand off consists of a set of static comps showing all the different page layouts/views and a stickersheet with various UI elements and their different states laid out, as well as a set hierarchy for typography. I’ll usually build out clickable prototypes in Invision or Adobe XD to show how certain features work, but those don’t usually get handed over. I wonder if there’s a way to do this without the static comps (wireframes)…
